greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of coefficients equal to zero in n-th cyclotomic polynomial.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537 (terms 1..1000 from T. D. Noe)
formula: When p is an odd prime and m integer >= 1: a(p^m) = a(2*p^m) = p^m - p^(m-1) - p + 1. In particular a(p) = a(2p) = 0. (End)
program: (PARI) A086798(n) = (1 + eulerphi(n) - length(select(x->x!=0, Vec(polcyclo(n))))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 21 2018
xref: Cf. A051664 (number of nonzero terms in n-th cyclotomic polynomial).
results.author: Yuval Dekel (dekelyuval(AT)hotmail.com), Aug 05 2003
ext: More terms from _Benoit Cloitre_ and _T. D. Noe_, Aug 06 2003
